current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To prevent human health threats posed by the consumption
		  of equines raised in the United States.

committee-name.#text:
Committee on Health, Education, Labor,
			 and Pensions

cosponsor.#tail:
) introduced the
			 following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

short-title.#text:
Safeguard American Food Exports Act of
			 2013

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section 409 of the Federal Food, Drug, and
			 Cosmetic Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act/s:409

text.#text:
equines raised in
			 the United States are frequently treated with substances that are not approved
			 for use in horses intended for human consumption and equine parts are therefore
			 unsafe within the meaning of

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section 512 of the Federal Food, Drug,
			 and Cosmetic Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act/s:512

text.#text:
equines raised in
			 the United States are frequently treated with drugs, including
			 phen­yl­bu­ta­zone, acepromazine, boldenone un­dec­y­len­ate, omep­ra­zole,
			 ketoprofen, xy­la­zine, hy­al­uron­ic acid, ni­tro­fu­ra­zone, polysulfated
			 gly­cos­ami­no­gly­can, clenbuterol, tolazoline, and ponazuril, which are not
			 approved for use in horses intended for human consumption and equine parts are
			 therefore unsafe within the meaning of

consuming parts of
			 an equine raised in the United States likely poses a serious threat to human
			 health and the public should be protected from these unsafe products.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is amended by adding at the end the
			 following:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Section 301 of the Federal Food, Drug, and
			 Cosmetic Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act/s:301

text.#text:
Notwithstanding
				any other provision of this section—

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act/s:409

text.#text:
equine parts
				shall be deemed unsafe under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act/s:512

text.#text:
equine parts
				shall be deemed unsafe under

the knowing sale
				or transport of equines or equine parts in interstate or foreign commerce for
				purposes of human consumption is hereby
				prohibited.

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 S541 IS: Safeguard American Food Exports Act of 2013

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}rights.#text: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
